thread.title: Portland Metro Monday Traffic: I-5 south crash near Marine Drive
thread.title_full: Portland Metro Monday Traffic: I-5 south crash near Marine Drive | OregonLive.com

author: Rosemarie Stein | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland Metro Monday Traffic: I-5 south crash near Marine Drive
text:
Daily traffic » All traffic news » PDX Traffic Alerts on Twitter » Elliot Njus's Hard Drive blog » All weather news » School closures/delays
Southbound I-5 traffic is currently being diverted to I-405 southbound due to a semi crash near the Rose Quarter. The crash happened about 1:30 a.m., but clean up is taking some time. They open to open the freeway by 7 a.m.
UPDATE 6:40 a.m.; ALL LANES OF I-5 SOUTH NOW OPEN AT ROSE QUARTER EXIT. Traffic no longer being diverted at I-405.
***
HILLSBORO 8 a.m.; Crash on Northwest 185th Avenue just north of U.S. 26 at Bronson Road.
***
UPDATE HILLSBORO 7:40 a.m.; Injury crash reported at Northwest Cornelius Pass Road and Evergreen Boulevard. CLEARED.
***
MILWAUKIE 7:11 a.m.; Police heading to a reported auto-pedestrian crash on Southeast Park Avenue at at McLoughlin Blvd.
***
UPDATE NORTH PORTLAND I/5 7:51 a.m.; New crash I/5 southbound in the middle lane near Marine Boulevard has traffic backing into Vancouver. CLEARED
***
A crash on Highway 219 (Hillsboro Highway) north of Farmington Road has emergency crews heading to that area as of 6 a.m. UPDATE 6:45 a.m.; CLEARED.
Weather forecasters say we'll have heavy fog in many areas through the morning commute. Remember to drive with the headlights on and expect low visibility in many areas.
When the fog is this heavy, walkers, bikers, and joggers need to realize that vehicles most likely can not see them. Make sure your aware of your surroundings and play it safe while crossing streets.
Check back throughout the morning for the latest commuting updates and follow us on Twitter: @trafficportland
#pdxtraffic Tweets Jerry Casey | The Oregonian/OregonLive
